I can't help it. I just don't trust humans.
I know you're not like the others, $OwnerName$. But… we're just so different.
I know we should all just accept one another, but I can't get used to your kind's disregard for nature or penchant for violence. Am I wrong to feel this way?
Nah.
Yeah.
No matter how hard I try, there's just some things I can't do. I don't know if a human could really understand…
I thought of all people you'd understand me. Just forget I said anything.
Thank you for understanding. All I want is for your kind to stop fighting and to live wisely!
$OwnerName$, I knew you'd understand. You're different from the rest.
$OwnerName$, I want to ask you something.
I've mentioned a few times that fairies aren't fond of humans.
But what's your opinion, $OwnerName$? Do you like fairies?
Of course.
I want to learn more about your species, honestly.
I've heard of humans who said the same thing, then brutally betrayed us. I'm not saying you're like that, but…
Just like that? It sounded a little insincere, if you ask me…
Ah! You and I are kindred spirits in that regard, $OwnerName$. I'm so happy we met!
Yes, I want to learn more about humans, too!
I made this pendant with a stone I found in my forest. Pretty, isn't it?
Heh heh, surprised? My mom taught me when I was young. She's a famous craftswoman in $map:02000023$.
But I don't think this is just some ordinary stone. It gives off a strange vibe, like… magic.
I want to know more! I'm going to show it to $npcName:11000031[gender:0]$ tomorrow.
Yesterday $npcName:11000034[gender:0]$ stopped by. He must have been worried that I'm staying with a human.
He kept urging me to return to the forest, but I told him I can better relate to you than I can to other humans. And it's true. Hehe.
$npcName:11000034[gender:0]$ would agree if he met you. If you ever have business in $map:02000023$, would you give my regards to $npcName:11000034[gender:0]$?
I prepare food for you every day, but do you really have to eat animals and plants?
Fairies only need one glass of honey milk in the morning and one in the afternoon. Animals and plants are my friends, and I shouldn't eat my friends, right?
You don't need to look so guilty. I know you can't live on just milk like I can.
"Nature makes us what we are." That's what $npcName:11000031[gender:0]$ says. Eat up!
Humans have long coveted the ancient knowledge of the fairies. They spy on us and try to steal it when we aren't looking.
Those who do are usually driven to ruin by their own greed!
With the current situation, we've had no choice but to join forces with humans, but that doesn't mean we like you. I've seen some pretty great humans but only a few of you are wise.
The wise humans know their place in the grand scheme of the universe. Then again… I doubt even $npcName:11000075[gender:1]$ is completely free of selfish desires…
Do all humans allow strangers into their homes? Today, three strangers barged in, but ran off when they saw I was here.
They were surprised, stating that they didn't hear my footsteps. Well, that's because fairies glide instead of stomp.
We don't want to hurt even a single blade of grass. Eeek! There are ants crawling all around your feet! Be careful not to step on them!!
Have you ever wondered why I don't have wings?
It's because there are all different types of fairies… Tree tree fairies, flower fairies, river fairies, and all sorts of others.
Some have wings, some don't… and some just have one wing…
Never mind that. My point is, if you ever visit $map:02000023$, make sure you don't ask such a silly question or everyone will laugh at you.
$npcName:11000284[gender:1]$… She's lost her shoes again. How disgraceful!
I've told her so many times! If she truly loves her shoes, then don't wear them outside of the forest!
Unbelievable! I hope no one helps her this time, so she learns her lesson.
…But that's wishful thinking. Humans can't resist helping her when she cries, and she knows that.
Yesterday, the wind told me that trees and flowers are disappearing on the west side of Victoria Island.
I'm guessing it must the area around $map:02000100$. I've never been there, and I'm glad! I couldn't survive even a single day in such a sad place.
Why do humans love to dig? Why do you love tall buildings so much?
You're building homes for yourselves but destroying ours.
I don't hate all humans. I have great respect for $npc:11000075[gender:1]$ and for $npcName:11000039[gender:1]$.
I have many things I can learn from $npcName:11000042[gender:1]$. I think there are only a handful of fairies who possess more ancient knowledge than he does.
Humans and fairies are so different. I'm having a hard time getting used to you. We haven't interacted with each other for a long time. You can't expect for us to become friends overnight.
Soon it'll be my birthday. Let's celebrate together. And don't even think to ask how many candles we'll need…
Oh, fine, since you're my friend, I'll give you a hint.
I just want one candle. I'm not even a hundred yet! I'm pretty young for the fairfolk.
Fairies live a lot longer than humans, you know.
You'd be shocked if you knew how old $npcName:11000033[gender:0]$ or $npcName:11000031[gender:0]$ are. You really just can't think of our ages in human years.
Lately $npcName:11000032[gender:0]$ hasn't looked so good. I'm worried something happened to him.
I tried to ask, but he wouldn't answer. $npcName:11000031[gender:0]$ seemed to know something, but he wouldn't tell me either.
Actually $npcName:11000032[gender:0]$ was the reason I got a job with Helping Hands. He left one day all of a sudden, and it dawned on me that I didn't know much about him.
$npcName:11000032[gender:0]$ is half-human and half-fairy. It must have been hard growing up like that, but he never showed it. I would've been nicer if I'd known he'd leave so abruptly…
That's why I wanted to learn more about humans. I'm glad I applied for this job. Staying here with you has been so informative!
Eeek! Human!! Sheesh, you scared me!
Sorry for startling you.
Ha! I'm gonna step on you!
Who are you?
…Oh. Well, that's okay.
I'm not used to talking to humans… It's okay, I forgive you.
Eeeeek!! G-go away!
I'm going to tell $npcName:11000031[gender:0]$! You'd better get away from me before I turn you into a frog!
M-me? I'm of the fairfolk… Eek, sorry! I don't think I'm ready to talk to strange humans!
H-hey, that doesn't matter. If you have business with <font color="#ffd200">$OwnerName$</font>, you don't need to talk to me.
Mm… Is this what a human abode looks like from the inside?
I hope the human isn't too violent…
H-human…!
Err… P-please don't talk to me…
I've been waiting for you.
What took you so long?
I can't tell what you're thinking.
Keeping a promise isn't easy.
I think I'm getting used to this.
I wonder how mom is doing…
Oh, I'd better prepare some food.
This should be enough, right?
I'd love to see more flowers around here.
La, la, la!
Let's see…
Hmph! What in blazes is it?
Why do you keep summoning me? Don't you know I'm old?

I would look so different right now if only… Ah… Never mind, just talking to myself. Hah hah.
Anyway, thank you for your kindness. Mushroom god, swine god, pour your blessings upon $OwnerName$.

But I've already looked through every single book there. They didn't have the one I wanted.
I heard there's a magic library inside a forest… Heard of it? They just might have something that'll help me lift this curse…

Grrr, that hag… One day, I'll make her… Aah! How long have you been standing there?

I think Dark Wind is suspicious of members of the Barrota Trading Company.
So… $OwnerName$, what do you think of Dark Wind?
Dark Wind is essential for keeping the peace in $map:2000100$.
That whole organization is rather shady…
Hm… You think so? I guess our opinions differ. I suppose that's only human nature.
Does that mean you think it's okay for them to treat me the way they do? The injustice!
I knew I couldn't be the only one who thought so! There's definitely something strange going on.
Right?! But that organization is already so entrenched in $map:2000100$… Anyway, thank you. Now I'm even more confident in my opinion.
Lately, I've been thinking maybe I gossip too much.
But hearing all sorts of rumors comes with my job. And it's not like I can just forget what I hear.
Should I stop telling others what I hear? What are your thoughts on this?
You should be careful about what you say.
I don't care either way.
You don't? But I don't want something bad to happen to me, so I'm thinking maybe I should stop.
You don't care. So that means you don't care if I tell others about you, right, $OwnerName$? I see what you do when you think I'm not looking…
I should, right? Thank you for being honest with me. I'll be more careful from now on.
But you like listening to me gossip, don't you, $OwnerName$? Still, I'm glad I asked.
Ahhh… Things haven't been so hot with the Barrota Trading Company.
We're Maple World's largest and most reputable group of traders! How did it come to this…?
I don't know how they knew where to find me, but a Dark Wind agent stopped by the house a while ago.
I swear to you, I've never done anything unethical as a hawker. Not once! Maybe a bit of gossip, but nothing even close to illegal.
He may be a Dark Wind agent, but that doesn't give him the right to treat me the way he did, accusing me of all sorts of horrible things, asking me all sorts of mean questions. I feel violated!
While taking care of your home, I've located many items that you don't use.
For example, this exercise equipment. Only used once or twice, am I correct?
$OwnerName$, with your permission, I'd like to sell these items. You get the benefit of less clutter, and I get the benefit of a cut of the profits. Win-win, all around, wouldn't you say?
I hung a banner over the door today, and a lot of people stopped by the house to shop.
I had no idea having a physical shop could be so convenient!
Ah, o-of course, $OwnerName$, this is your house, but I get bored sitting around, waiting for you.
So I was thinking… You don't mind if I do my business in your house from time to time, do you?
Okay, so you know $npc:11000074[gender:0]$ in $map:02000001$? He's a trusted subject of $npcName:11000075[gender:1]$.
He has a daughter, $npcName:11000058[gender:1]$. She lives in her father's mansion in $map:02000119$.
But rumor has it that the minister had another daughter…
No, not a lovechild. Sheesh, what are you talking about? $npcName:11000058[gender:1]$ had a twin sister, and she disappeared all of a sudden.
It happened a long time ago, so no one knows if her sister is alive or dead. Tragic, isn't it?
This is kind insane, but $npcName:11000252[gender:0]$ in $map:02000100$ has a big secret.
Who? Really? You've never heard of Goldus Group?
Goldus Group partakes in all sorts of businesses—real estate, banking, pharmaceutical, to name a few.
And its chairman is—hm, I don't know if I should tell you this.
Its chairman is… He's actually…
Ugh, no, I can't. If this gets out, the Barrota Trading Company can get in huge trouble.
Hawkers travel everywhere in Maple World. Some of us have even recently dared to enter the Shadow World.
Rumor has it that a hawker named $npcName:11000609[gender:0]$ returned from that shadowy realm, looking like he'd seen a ghost.
He was lucky. Blackstar protects merchants. I'd be surprised if a normal person made it back from that world.
$OwnerName$, don't you dare even think of going there. Stop it. Stop. I know you're already thinking about it…
They say Maple World is in shambles because of the actions of one young, harmless-looking man named… Um… What was his name?
Whatever. Dark Wind is searching everywhere for him.
I saw his wanted poster in $map:02000100$. He has blond hair, red eyes, and a scar on his face.
$OwnerName$, if you see anyone looking like him, you should report him to Dark Wind. That way you can collect the bounty and share it with me.
I have my reasons for being a hawker. Money is one of them, sure. I mean, we all need money, right?
But that's not the only reason. It might be hard for residents of big cities like $map:02000001$ to imagine, but some folks really do live far, far away from civilization.
And those people need me to get things for them. They count the days until my next visit and watch me approach with excitement in their eyes.
It's not easy traveling over rough terrain, weighed down with a backpack of cargo…
But I truly love it. Selling valued items, delivering news… I get so caught up in all of it that I lose track of time.
The Barrota Trading Company is Maple World's hawker union. We've got hundreds of members, hawking all over the world.
We don't just sell items. People also rely on us to deliver the latest news.
Think of it this way: If this world were a body, we'd be the blood vessels spreading life throughout it! Haha!
Well, we're in a tight spot right now, but it's got to be some sort of misunderstanding. I couldn't imagine Maple World without hawkers.
$OwnerName$, you may not remember this…
Long ago, we first met in $map:63000001$. You were looking for a trip to get to $map:02000062$ for the Empress's event, remember?
It's okay if you don't remember. I've got a good enough memory for the both of us. In fact, the whole trading company knows about my superb memory.
Back then, I was so excited about the Empress's little shindig… Who would've thought we'd end up living in the same house? The future is full of secrets, isn't it?
I've never really given serious thought to settling down. What can I say? I just love being a hawker.
Now, $npcName:11000170[gender:0]$, on the other hand, he found himself a lady while selling his wares. Says he's ready to settle down. He just has to work up the courage to talk to the girl.
It's made me think. I don't know, maybe someday I want to settle down, too… Have a family, all that…
But not yet. First, I want to hustle and build up an amazing reputation as a hawker!
Welcome! Is there something you're looking for?
Show me your wares.
I really don't care.
I thought this was a house, not a store.
Oh. Right. Nobody actually says that. I don't actually have my wares on me right now, you see… Heh… Heh…
I would love too, but all my items are completely sold out for the day? Where do you live? I'll carry all my goods to you later this week for your own personal shopping experience.
Oh, come on, doesn't cost anything to take a look!
Hm… Then why are you here?
Oh, too bad… You see, I'm offering a 90% discount for anyone who visits here to see me. You sure you're not here for me?

Welcome! Feel free to take a look around.

"Why do fairies live so much longer than humans," hmm? An excellent question. The secret to our longevity isn't quite what popular opinion would lead you to believe.
Most believe our ability to commune with nature grants us a regenerative ability that slows aging.
That's not quite right. The answer is actually because we are embodiments of nature herself. We live long lives the same way trees live for millennia and turtles live for centuries.
As for why humans can't, it's simple. You refuse to submit to nature. You've decided to change your destinies. And that's why you and I have drastically different natural lifespans.
Does that answer your question?
That's absurd!
Yup!
Just because you don't understand it doesn't make it untrue… Now you've upset me.
I didn't expect you to fully understand, but I didn't expect you to react quite like this, $OwnerName$.
Oh, you understood all that? Your comprehension skills are better than I estimated. I think I can come to enjoy conversing with you.
If you have other questions, you may ask them, but try to space it out, okay?
$OwnerName$, why don't you ask yourself a question. For example, whether humans did the right thing in rejecting nature? That's rather philosophical, don't you think?
Ah, look at the time! I talked for longer than I thought. Well, that's because I enjoyed our conversation.
Why is the sea such a pretty blue? Are you looking for the scientific answer or the poetic one? I can't speak to why you think blue is pretty, so I'll answer the scientific question instead.

When light hits the sea, all light waves except the one that our eye interpret as the color blue is absorbed into the water. Do you understand? Similarly, red roses only reflect the red ray, which is why they look red.
Do you really believe that? Truly?
I disagree with you.
Then what is your opinion, $OwnerName$? Debate begins with a difference of opinion, and they often result in enlightenment and shifts in perspective.
So… you think the sea is blue because fairies painted it blue? Do you… really believe that? Well, let's not talk about it, then. I don't wish to argue.
Interesting. It's a pretty simple and well-known scientific fact, but you disagree. Well, what's your theory, $OwnerName$?
You don't know? But how can you disagree if you don't have your own idea of what the answer is? This conversation is nonsense.
What I just explained is the most well-accepted theory, but explaining nature with science can be harsh on your spirit and soul. Truth be told, I have a different idea.

In my heart, I believe that the sea is blue because it saw that the sky was beautiful and wanted to emulate it. Or because it's a mirror to the sky's own beauty. Or maybe, the sky touched the sea once, staining it forever…
I know that such theories aren't science. But still, they bring me joy. I hope you'll remember that, $OwnerName$.
Scientific facts are not based on belief. They're facts. Absolute. But I like that you asked that question. It shows you don't want to see the world through the lens of pure fact.
That type of mental flexibility will help you grow as a person, $OwnerName$. Trust me. I have an eye for that kind of stuff.
You have another question? Am I your walking encyclopedia? I'm sorry, but I'm in the middle of something. Maybe next time.
I'm sorry, but I don't have time to answer a question right now. As you can clearly see, I'm very busy. This isn't because I don't know the answer…

This is a story from so long ago that even history doesn't known when it happened. It's from a time when fairies could speak to the stars, wind, and moon. I wasn't there personally. This is a tale known to all fairies who love reading.
It is about a male fairy, his sister, and an evil witch. <font color="#909090">(He goes on and on, summarizing the story from a historian's perspective.)</font>
<font color="#909090">(He goes into a lot of boring details and even the exciting moments are dragged down by his unnecessary analyses.)</font>
And thus, the brother and sister concluded their adventure. Did you enjoy the tale? You're an excellent listener. I enjoyed relaying the story to you.
This time, I will share something I experienced firsthand. I've seen quite a lot in my not-so-short life, and I'm sure you'd enjoy some of my extraordinary tales.
When I was young and curious, I traveled to many locales, even though I don't much care for traveling. This tale takes us to a remove village in the far south, whose name I can no longer remember.
There was a big tree in the center of the village, which the villagers consulted for important events…
<font color="#909090">(He goes into a lot of boring details and even the exciting moments are dragged down by his unnecessary analyses.)</font>
In the end, I left that village to return home, but I still wonder sometimes… what was that tree? Was it really holy?
I experienced that personally, and I guarantee everything I said is 100% truth. Well, I may have exaggerated a little, but doesn't that just make it 120% truth?
I can't right now. I just can't. Not even for you, $OwnerName$. You understand, don't you?
Right now? I can't just come up with a story on the spot, $OwnerName$. Also, I'm busy.
I don't like talking about myself, $OwnerName$, and I prefer to keep things professional. Please understand that.
If we were friends, I might change my mind, but I don't feel comfortable sharing. Please don't be upset.
Well, let's see. My name is $MaidName$. I am fairfolk. I wear glasses. I have green hairs and eyes. I enjoy reading. But… this isn't the information you're after, is it?
Allow me to make this clear so that it doesn't happen again: I do not like being asked about my personal life. If you wish to talk, I enjoy discussing topics of a more academic nature.
$OwnerName$, why do you slather half the things you eat in ketchup? What appeals to you about that red sauce? I find it quite sour. Why do humans enjoy it so much?
However, I do find myself quite drawn to the taste of mayonnaise. Its ivory tone, its light scent, its creamy taste… Mmm, dip a celery stick in some mayo, and this fairfolk is in heaven!

$OwnerName$, last time when you asked me my age, I may have been a little harsh. I still don't wish to reveal my exact age, but I'm willing to give you some idea: I'm ridiculously old in human years but fairly young in fairfolk years.
We must've grown close, $OwnerName$. I find that I don't mind telling you about myself, and I even catch myself thinking of you as a friend.
What brings you to this residence?
I'm here to see your master.
I came to check out the house.
I wanted you to tell me an old tale.
Ah, then that makes you a friend. Hold on, I'll bring you some tea.
Strange that I've never heard of you. Ah well, please make yourself at home.
You can't just barge into a someone's home because you're curious about it…
Are you here the judge the owner's taste in interior design? If so, please proceed, but please don't make too much noise.
What do you mean by "an old tale"? Are you referring to the stories I tell the owner of this house? But you're a stranger. Why would I tell you a thing?
Perhaps if we were friends, I would, but we've just met. Don't you think you're being a bit impolite?
So this is the human abode I'll be working in, starting today.
It's my first day as a servant. I better get this right.
Who's there? What brings you here?
Wait! Who's there?
Welcome. I haven't seen you for a while.
Welcome. Did anything special happen today?
I'm rather bored.
I feel like I'm suffocating…
Interesting!
I should purchase some new books this weekend.
Glasses are inconvenient.
Nothing is as exciting as reading books and soaking in the knowledge and experiences relayed by their authors!
I should probably take a break…
That was it.

So… hm… how do I say this?
I thought you might be hungry, so I cooked this for you. I'm not the best chef, so… well, I hope you like it.
I found the recipe in a cookbook. It's stir-fried chicken feet.
I don't eat chicken feet. Are you kidding?
Thanks.
Oh, really? Hmm, maybe I should've learned more about you before embarking on this project.
Oh. Well, everyone has some foods they don't like. Don't worry, it won't go to waste. I guess I'll eat it all.
Thank you for eating with me. I'm glad you're enjoying it, or at least pretending too.
I was worried you might not like it. $OwnerName$, you're kinder than I expected.
Ugh, my colleague $npc:11000600[gender:0]$ is such a pain.
He's good at his job, but he's so forgetful. He called me three times today, thinking he was calling his mother.
This has happened so many times that I've started to wonder if he's doing it on purpose.
He likes you. Hehe.
You're overreacting.
Am I? Maybe you're right. I shouldn't waste my time on something so unproductive. Excuse me, I'd better get back to work.
He's young, but so forgetful. Maybe I should tell him to go to the doctor.
Wh-what? That's ridiculous! He's much younger than I am.
Goodness, $OwnerName$, you should expend your brainpower on managing your investments, not coming up with silly ideas!
Nothing of importance happened, but I do want to remind you of something: even though I'm here to watch your house that doesn't mean you shouldn't stop by to check on things now and then.
And don't say, "I trust you to handle it, $MaidName$." I mean, that's sweet, but you shouldn't put so much faith in others or they'll stomp all over you.
But I mean, it's still nice to hear. Thank you.
I'm utterly exhausted. I have no idea how they found me…

A group of strangers barged into the house and bombarded me with questions. "What's the hottest neighborhood right now?" "Share your best real estate tips!" That type of thing. By the time they left, I was beat.
But I couldn't just ignore them. Haha, no way. A good real estate agent would never do anything to jeopardize her reputation.
While performing my housekeeping duties today, I decided to check on your finances: your sources of income, spending habits, value of assets, that type of thing.
And… goodness, you're in worse shape than I imagined! You waste your money on useless stuff, and you don't get paid regularly!
At this rate, you'll never be able to afford a house near $map:2000001$. For starters, I highly suggest your improve your skills so that you don't have to spend so much money on potions!
Knowledge is money. A good way to produce income is to sell the items you find to people who understand their true value.

How do you find those people? I'll give you some examples. A few days ago, $npc:11000004[gender:0]$ in $map:2000001$ used megaphones to advertise his new items and that's how he reached the buyers willing to pay the most.
Rumor has it that Dark Wind agent $npc:11000208[gender:0]$ auctioned something he found during his mission on $map:2000216$ and he made a lot of money, too.
There are a lot of ways to get the most for your money. It just depends on your personal preference, $OwnerName$.
You know $npc:11000002[gender:1]$, who lives in $map:2000001$? Your question made me think of her.
$npc:11000002[gender:1]$ had lived her whole life in $map:2000076$, but moved to where she lives now about twenty years ago. That was before the areas around $map:2000001$ were developed.
$npc:11000002[gender:1]$'s house is worth a lot of money now. Makes sense, considering its proximity to the palace.
But I don't think $npc:11000002[gender:1]$ wants to sell. She wants to live like she has been, raising $npc:11000055[gender:0]$.
That was the home she lived in with $npc:11000055[gender:0]$'s father, so it holds sentimental value. She'd be rich if she sold, though. Just goes to show, you never can tell, can you?
I worry about you, you know. I'm glad you're showing more interest in your finances. All right, listen carefully.
What makes a person wealthy? The possession of mesos, right?
Mesos rarely grow on trees, so instead of wishing for good luck, think about what you can tangibly do to make more money. Understand?
Complete every quest available to you. They pay fairly well. The people of Maple World understand that nothing is free.
Everyone wants to be rich, and honestly, the concept is simple: make more money, spend less money.
But life gets pretty bleak if you never spend any money at all. So here's what I do: I shop when I want to, but I don't buy things I don't need.

For example, I saw a gorgeous dress at the market, and I've been debating for two weeks whether to get it. The cool blue tone would look amazing with my complexion… I'll sleep on it for just one more night.
I know you're curious about my past, $OwnerName$, but I distinctly remember asking you to keep our relationship strictly professional.
I'm not your friend—I'm your housekeeper. I'm happy to answer any questions related to my work, your finances, and nothing else.
I know what you're really trying to get at is whether I'm single. We'll leave it a mystery for now.
Have you heard of $npc:11000491[gender:1]$? She's the owner of Cathy Mart, and her business has really gotten popular lately. She paid $map:2000123$ a visit the other day.

She was looking to open a big store near $map:2000001$, which is fantastic, but oh my, what an obnoxious woman. She said she had enough money to buy all of Goldus Group and the entirety of $map:2000025$.
I don't know what she's thinking, but having a couple of supermarkets is not the same as running a corporation as big as Goldus Group. Seriously.
She used up my entire afternoon and then just left, whining about how there was no location good enough. I've never met such an unpleasant person in my life.
$OwnerName$, so we're clear, I will never buy you a thing—even a potion—from Cathy Mart. Got it?
You want to know more about my colleague,$npc:11000600[gender:0]$? Well, he's a nice person. Diligent, polite.
He has a long way to go before becoming a good agent, though. He trips when he walks and forgets to bring important documents. I constantly have to babysit him.
Yesterday he came over here, so I asked him what he needed. He said he thought this was his house. How such a young man can be so forgetful is beyond me.
My real name? What does it matter? You're going to call me whatever you want, anyway, haha.
I know some people think I'm $npc:11000252[gender:0]$'s only daughter, haha.
Let me tell you this: I owe $npc:11000252[gender:0]$ a lot. I wish he were my father, but he and I are not related.
Please don't ask me what happened with the Chairman. I worked for him for a long time. Trust me when I tell you that not everything you hear about him is true.
I agree he's changed, but there has to be a reason. At least, I'd like to believe that.
How may I help you? Do you need a real estate agent?
Yep!
Nope!
Who are you?
I'm sorry, but this is my other workplace. I can help you if you come visit me at $map:2000123$ in $map:2000001$.
If it's not urgent, please talk to my assistant, $npc:11000600[gender:0]$. I'm in the middle of something very important.
I see. But I've got the perfect property for you. If you let it slip between your fingers, you might regret it forever.
Now, would you like to follow me to my office?
Then what you are doing here? Don't tell me your here to burglarize the house. Let's be serious.
My name is $MaidName$, and I'm in charge. If you don't have business here, please leave.
Leave the management of your house in my capable hands.
Nice to meet you. I'm thrilled to be here.
How may I help you?
What business do you have with the owner of this house?
You're back! You've been gone for so long that I actually started to worry a little.
$npc:11000600[gender:0]$? …Oh, it's just you.
It's impossible to tell what the future holds.

I don't have time to take a break.
I'm thirsty…
Not too shabby.

My dream is to go to $map:2000100$. I've heard it's filled with beautiful shiny things. I'd love to see it with my own eyes.
But $npcName:11000368[gender:0]$ says I can't. It's too dangerous. $OwnerName$, what do you think? Can I go to $map:2000100$?
No.
Only if I go with you.
$OwnerName$, you're just like $npcName:11000368[gender:0]$! Both of you think I'm too weak to do anything, and it makes me so mad!
The more you say no, the more I want to do it. That's the way a fairy is! Ugh, I want to go there. I want to go there. I really want to go there!
Really?! You're going with me? Then let's go! I want to go right now!
Really? Yippee! I am sooooo so so so happy right now!
This is bad… What do I do?
I use illusions to help people, but I keep getting them in trouble. I'm a disgrace to the fairfolk.
Maybe I should stop messing with illusions altogether.
You're overreacting.
Maybe… a little?
You don't have to say it. I already know it. Words can cut deep, you know.
You're so insensitive, $OwnerName$. Maybe that's why your face is so ugly. Hmph.
Do you mean that? Really? I wish everyone was more like you, $OwnerName$.
Thank you, $OwnerName$. I feel much better now.
A friend of mine came to see me for the first time after a long time. His name is $npcName:11000368[gender:0]$ and he lives in $map:02000017$.
He's round and furry. I love him very much. $OwnerName$, have you met him by any chance?
I was so happy to see him that I danced. But then I noticed that $npcName:11000368[gender:0]$ looked very sad.
$npcName:11000368[gender:0]$ said humans are destroying the forest and that a lot of the zelkovas and willows are gone now.
I can't imagine losing my friends. I just said "see you later!" to them a few days ago…
Not a thing… I may have cracked the wall over there…
S-sorry! It's all my fault!! Wahhhh!
I wanted to know if the $item:30000104$ $npcName:11000368[gender:0]$ gave me was real, so I threw it at the tree in the back of the house… All of it.
The tree grew taller than the house in the blink of an eye! I thought I was going to be swallowed alive!
$npcName:11000368[gender:0]$ said I should be careful… I should've listened to him. This is all because I didn't trust my friend.
$OwnerName$! $OwnerName$! I've got something for you!
Tah-dah! I made these shoes for you! I've even embroidered your name right here, $OwnerName$. Try them on!
… … … They don't fit… $OwnerName$, your feet are too big.
I thought you were the same size as me. I was wrong. I'm sad now. Waaahhh!
My illusions don't last forever because they're thoughts from my head given shape and form.
And thoughts never last long. To keep my illusions up, I have to think about them constantly, but my head gets filled with new thoughts all the time.
Some of the other fairies have such great concentration they can retain illusions for a very long time, but not me.
I'm doomed! I made a hole in the wall, so I placed an illusion on it. Now the illusion's gone because I was distracted for a second. Waaaah.
It's not easy to cast illusions. I have to be happy, or my thoughts won't materialize.
The more exciting a thought, the easier it is to materialize it. That's why I can't resurrect the dead or hurt people with my illusions. Even if I could, I would never do it.
Humans often think fairies are mischievous because of our illusionism. But it's entertaining, isn't it? Heh heh!
I can cast illusions. All fairies can.
Illusionism is not magic. They're two different things.
The fairies of Ellinia use magic. It's the great—and scary—power of nature.
But we use illusionism, a mysterious and interesting power unique to us.
Illusionism enables us to materialize the thoughts in our heads. The problem is that you can't always perfectly control your thoughts. You have to be careful when you cast illusions.
Did you just ask me to cast an illusion? Did you really?
All right! Count on me! Now, what kind of illusion do you want?
You want to grow taller? That's easy, $OwnerName$! Real easy!
Abracadingdong! Yaliyali pingpong! Grow tall!
I-I'm sorry… Only your head grew bigger… Actually it was big before, and now it's even bigger…
I thought I was the only fairfolk who loses shoes all the time, but I'm not.
Sometimes I can hear one of the fairfolk crying about lost shoes somewhere near $map:02000023$. $OwnerName$, could you go help her?
From her voice, I can tell she's a pretty fairfolk. Ahem, $OwnerName$, you look like you're too busy to help her. I'll go.
I'm so scared of humans. I can't help it! You're scary and I'm shy!
But, $OwnerName$, you're different. You're kind and affectionate. I hope all humans can be more like you.
But I'm not ready to meet them. Once, a human swindled me out of all my money.
$OwnerName$, I know you're good, but I can't trust the others of your kind.
Some fairies hibernate. $npcName:11000368[gender:0]$ does. So does $npcName:11000677$.
They say they can't stop themselves from falling asleep. I don't hibernate, so I wouldn't know.
They get really irritated if their sleep is interrupted. Some fairies even attack anyone who wakes them up.
So if you see some fairies hibernating, you'd better let them sleep. Got it?
$npcName:11000368[gender:0]$ keeps telling everyone that I'm timid, and it's getting on my nerves! I'm not timid at all!
Remember how I spent all of last Friday preparing dinner for you, $OwnerName$? And you said the soup was salty? See? I'm bold! I'm not too timid to use a lot of salt!
You know what, I don't care what $npcName:11000368[gender:0]$ says. I'm not upset at him.
I mean it! I know I'm not the timid fairfolk he thinks I am! I'm bold… and I'm magnanimous and forgiving! That's right, I'm pretty amazing!
A s-stranger…?! D-did you come for me?!
Yep!
Nope!
Who are you?
B-but wh-what for? I-I didn't do anything wrong!
Wh-what kind of business do you have with me? I'm one of the fairfolk! I c-can illusion you!! I can!!
Whew! …Then why are you in this house?
Really? You scared me for a moment.
My name is $MaidName$. I'm one of the good fairies.
A fairfolk can stay in a human's house. There's nothing wrong with that!
I've never lived with a human before!
This is going to be fun!
…A s-stranger?!
Wh-who are you?!
You look exhausted.
Welcome home.
I'm so depressed…
I've got nothing to do…
I might as well cast some illusions…
This place is filled with wonderful things!
Humans are so high maintenance.
I'm so good at cleaning now.
I like laundry the best. I can take a bubble bath at the same time!
I'm feeling a bit sleepy…
Ack, my illusion is gone!
Home sweet home!
What brings you here?
Sailing is always a breeze. Hee. See what I did there?
What seems to be the problem?
Oh dear, you're barely clinging to life! Would you like to pay $paneltyPrice$ mesos to get treated now?
You're looking pretty healthy to me, $MyPCName$, but if you're ever sick or wounded, I can help.
Everyone gets sick now and then, you know.
When that happens, I can heal you.
My services are available for a modest fee.
What brings you here?

Everyone wants to join the Royal Guard, but very few are actually qualified. It is imperative that Royal Guard members be strong in body and spirit, for we are the Empress's last line of defense. Hmm, I must admit, you do seem fairly strong.
We're always looking for great swordsmen with the strength to protect the Empress and her palace. How'd you like to join the Royal Guard?

In times like this, only we can protect Her Majesty and Minister $npcName:11000074[gender:0]$. It's the most important job in the world. After you've grown a bit stronger, you should consider joining the Royal Guard.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?

We royal guards protect the palace under the command of Minister $npcName:11000074[gender:0]$. Even though the much-awaited court was canceled because of the earthquake, there is no price too high when it comes to keeping the empress safe. We must honor our oath to protect her from anything, or anyone, that would do her harm.
Don't tell me you've never heard of Minister $npcName:11000074[gender:0]$?
Hmm. I knew people had traveled far and wide to attend the royal court, but you must have come from very far away to be so ignorant of the recent happenings in $map:02000001$.
I'm quite busy at the moment, but I'm sure there are plenty of people in $map:02000001$ who would be happy to educate you.

As it stands, you're too weak to fend for yourself, let alone protect the Empress. $npc:11000004[gender:0]$ is a merchant of fine equipment, and probably has some excellent Knight gear for sale. Go get suited up, and commence your training beyond the walls of $map:02000001$!

As you train, you'll ascend to new levels, and become ready to learn new skills. To see the skills you can learn, press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>.

Want to <font color="#ffd200">upgrade a skill</font>? Press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>, then press the plus sign next to the skill you'd like to improve.
Upgrading skills requires various types of crystals. One type, $itemPlural:40100001$, are available for purchase from supply merchant $npcName:11000010[gender:1]$ here in $map:02000001$.
<font color="#ffd200">Upgrading skills</font> requires Crystals.

$itemPlural:40100001$ are what remains after polishing rough crystals, and they're distributed throughout Maple World by $map:02000051$. You can easily find them by talking to supply merchants in big cities.

Of course, some materials are rarer than others, in particular the Red, Blue, and Green Crystals. They possess so much power that they are unstable, and only <font color="#ffd200">Elite</font> or <font color="#ffd200">Boss</font> enemies will drop them, and very infrequently.
As for $itemPlural:40100022$, I don't think you're quite ready.
You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become a… Berserker? Well, I hope you don't regret your decision.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?
You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become a… Wizard? Well, I hope you don't regret your decision.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?
You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become a… Priest? I suppose they have their own role to play on the battlefield. Well, I hope you don't regret your decision.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?
You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become an… Archer? Well, I hope you don't regret your decision.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?
You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become a… Heavy Gunner? Well, I hope you don't regret your decision.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?
You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become a… Thief? What a dishonorable profession. Perhaps you weren't cut out for the job in the first place.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?

You passed up your opportunity to join the Royal Guard to become an… Assassin? You'd better not be conducting any business in our fair city unless you want to spend the rest of your life rotting in the dungeon.
Tell me about the Royal Guard.
Who is $npc:11000074[gender:0]$?
Do you want to become a true warrior?

Argh, this place is so boring, it's driving me crazy! If it weren't for the War Chief's order, I would be cracking skulls on Vayar Mountain and having a blast! Hey, you look pretty tough. How are you in a fight?

With a greatsword in our hands, we're fearless in battle. We can be overzealous sometimes, but that's inevitable when you've got our passion for fighting. So, how'd you like to swear fealty to the War Chief and walk the path of the Berserker?

Argh, this place is so boring, it's driving me crazy! If it weren't for the War Chief's order, I would be cracking skulls on Vayar Mountain and having a blast! Hey, you look pretty tough. How are you in a fight?
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
We wouldn't be able to survive the sunbaked steppes of $map:02000051$ if it weren't for our War Chief. He's a great warrior and greater leader. Our trust in him is unwavering.
If you want to meet him, then go to $map:02000051$'s western plateau. But first, you'll have to get approval from his son and our vice chief, $npc:11000009[gender:0]$.
Oh, and when you see him, just be yourself and be honest. He can tell instantly when you're hiding something.
You must not get around much if you haven't heard of Vayar Mountain. It's south of $map:02000051$. We named it after the giant golems that lurk inside.

The golems, or Vayars, were created by the ancients to protect their sanctum. That was centuries ago, and the ancients are long gone. But the Vayars remain, protecting the mountain from any adventurers brave or foolish enough to enter.
Speaking of which, I've heard rumors that someone evaded the Vayars' detection and snuck into the mountain. What was their name? I can't remember…

Sometimes in the heat of battle, I achieve inhuman feats simply because, in my rage, I forget fear and all my weaknesses. I wouldn't count that as a blessing, though… Some things are worth forgetting, but you must never forget who you are. Now, was there something you wanted to ask me?
What should I do now?
First, arm yourself to the teeth. $npc:11000004[gender:0]$ is a merchant of fine equipment, and probably has some great Berserker equipment for sale. Gear up and head out to battle!

Crush all the foes who stand before you, and you will soon grow to new levels. Then you will find yourself ready to learn new skills. To see the <font color="#ffd200">skills you can learn</font>, press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>.

Want to <font color="#ffd200">upgrade a skill</font>? Press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>, then press the plus sign next to the skill you'd like to improve.
Upgrading skills requires various types of crystals. One type, $itemPlural:40100001$, are available for purchase from supply merchant $npcName:11000010[gender:1]$ here in $map:02000001$.
<font color="#ffd200">Upgrading skills</font> requires <font color="#ffd200">Crystals</font>.

$itemPlural:40100001$ are what remains after polishing rough crystals, and they're distributed throughout Maple World by $map:02000051$. You can easily find them by talking to supply merchants in big cities.

Of course, some materials are rarer than others, in particular the Red, Blue, and Green Crystals. They possess so much power that they are unstable, and only <font color="#ffd200">Elite</font> or <font color="#ffd200">Boss</font> enemies will drop them, and very infrequently.
There's also $itemPlural:40100022$, but I don't think you're ready for those just yet.
You've really chosen to become a Knight? I don't know what you'll accomplish waving a dinky sword like that around, but good luck surviving.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.

You've really chosen to become a Knight? I don't really see how shouting gibberish from musty old tomes is going to keep you alive in battle, but I won't tell you how to live what's left of your life.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
A priest? You've chosen to be a Priest? A fat lot of good prayer is going to do you against a horde of charging Koborcs.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.

You've really chosen to become an Archer? Striking down hapless foes from a distance is great, until your quiver runs dry. When the enemy comes bearing down on you, you'll wish you'd gone with a blade.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
You've chosen to become a Heavy Gunner, of all things? Guns are a crutch of the cowardly. A true warrior faces their opponent head on. Don't look to me when that cannon jams in the heat of battle.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
You've chosen to become a Thief? Throwing your only weapons at the enemy seems like a foolhardy strategy, but who am I to stand in the way of a someone with a deathwish?
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
You've chosen to become an Assassin? Skulking around in the shadows, hoping to strike without being seen… There's no honor in that.
Tell me about the war chief.
Tell me about Vayar Mountain.
Ugh… I hate being bothered. What is it?
Honestly, I don't care about politics or the court. My time is much better spent reading books in $map:02000031$.

People don't understand the value to be found in dusty tomes and conversing with the fairies in $map:02000023$. But you have a certain inquisitiveness in your eyes, an intellectual spark. You might make a good Wizard. I'm not going to push, but if you're the arcane arts, I'd be willing to assist you.

Honestly, I don't care about politics or the court, and you shouldn't waste your time on things like that either. Come see me if you ever want to discuss what actually matters in this world. I've got plenty of wisdom to share.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?

It seems the simple minds of ordinary folk can't understand us Wizards. We're more interested in scholarly matters, like understanding the origin of this world and what caused the earthquake, than we are in whether the empress holds her court.
Some people think the earthquake was not a naturally occurring phenomenon, and I'm inclined to agree with them. There's evidence to support such a theory…
And you have to admit, it's suspicious that the palace canceled court, which would have been the first one in quite a long time, just because of a simple earthquake. Very suspicious indeed…

A Wizard's life is lonely and difficult. We can never stop studying until we reach the very zenith of magical knowledge. You've got quite a road ahead of you. Is there anything you want to ask a fellow scholar?
What should I do now?

Before begin your journey, you should see that you're properly equipped. $npc:11000004[gender:0]$ is a purveyor of fine equipment, and probably has some adequate Wizard gear for sale. Buy whatever supplies are necessary, and venture out into that great, wide world to expand your knowledge!

As your studies progress, you will attain new levels. This will allow you to learn new skills. To see the <font color="#ffd200">skills you can learn</font>, press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>.

When you're ready to <font color="#ffd200">upgrade a skill</font>, just press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>, then press the plus sign next to the skill you'd like to improve.
Upgrading skills requires various types of crystals. One type, $itemPlural:40100001$, are available for purchase from supply merchant $npcName:11000010[gender:1]$ here in $map:02000001$.
<font color="#ffd200">Upgrading skills</font> requires <font color="#ffd200">Crystals</font>.

$itemPlural:40100001$ are what remains after polishing rough crystals, and they're distributed throughout Maple World by $map:02000051$. You can easily find them by talking to supply merchants in big cities.

Of course, some materials are rarer than others, in particular the Red, Blue, and Green Crystals. They possess so much power that they are unstable, and only <font color="#ffd200">Elite</font> or <font color="#ffd200">Boss</font> enemies will drop them, and very infrequently. It would be best to hunt such foes with a party.
And as for $itemPlural:40100022$—well, you can learn about those on your own.
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Knight.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Berserker.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Priest.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Archer.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Heavy Gunner.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Thief.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
Honestly, we don't care about politics or the empress's court. Nor do we care that you've chosen the path of the Assassin.
What do you care about?
What caused the earthquake?
How may I help you?

The recent earthquake has struck fear into the hearts of many. We restore the people's hope by spreading the goddess's teachings. Would you join us on our holy mission? You seem more than qualified to serve the goddess.
Illuminate this world with your good heart and unshakable faith. The goddess awaits with open arms all who you will shepherd into the light.
The recent earthquake has struck fear into the hearts of many. We restore the people's hope by spreading the goddess's teachings. Would you join us on our holy mission?
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
The road between $map:02000062$ and $map:02000001$ bore the brunt of the earthquake's damage. Fortunately, the road was nearly deserted when the shaking began.
I know that many are disappointed about the court's cancellation, but I think the can all agree that our current focus should be on supporting one another, and dealing with the damage of the quake.
Oh, what a silly question! She's the empress, of course. $npc:11000075[gender:1]$ was surely just as disappointed about the court as everyone else, but her safety is paramount to Maple World.

If you're here for an audience with the Empress, you might as well go home. She's too busy these days governing the realm. Since the incident, the people have relied on her strong leadership more than ever.
Don't forget, you're now an agent of the Empress and, by extension, an agent of the goddess. It is your duty to perform good deeds and help the weak. Now, do you have any questions?
What should I do now?

To help the weak and needy, you yourself must be strong. $npc:11000004[gender:0]$ is a merchant of fine equipment, and probably has some excellent Priest gear for sale. Once you're properly equipped, you should venture forth and enact the will of the goddess.

In your service to the goddess, you'll inevitably reach new levels. When this happens you'll be able to learn new skills. To see the <font color="#ffd200">skills you can learn</font>, press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>.
Press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>, then press the plus sign next to the skill you'd like to improve.
Upgrading skills requires various types of crystals. One type, $itemPlural:40100001$, are available for purchase from supply merchant $npcName:11000010[gender:1]$ here in $map:02000001$.
<font color="#ffd200">Upgrading skills</font> requires <font color="#ffd200">Crystals</font>.

$itemPlural:40100001$ are what remains after polishing rough crystals, and they're distributed throughout Maple World by $map:02000051$. You can easily find them by talking to supply merchants in big cities.

Of course, some materials are rarer than others, in particular the Red, Blue, and Green Crystals. They possess so much power that they are unstable, and only <font color="#ffd200">Elite</font> or <font color="#ffd200">Boss</font> enemies will drop them, and very infrequently.
$itemPlural:40100022$, you are dangerous, and must be handled with care.
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Knight. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Berserker. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Wizard. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Archer. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Heavy Gunner. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Thief. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
I'm afraid you cannot join the priesthood, as you've already chosen the path of the Assassin. Nonetheless, I pray for your prosperity.
How bad was the quake?
Who is $npc:11000075[gender:1]$?
Whatever this is, please get to the point.

The Green Hoods are a militia group with a long, storied history. Right now, we're keeping an eye on the opportunists who might try to take advantage of the chaos of recent events. We want to prevent as much crime as possible, but that requires talent and mettle. And you… you look like you've got both of those.
Our sharp arrows never miss their targets. How would you like to join us on our mission to restore order to this world?
The Green Hoods are a militia group with a long, storied history. How'd you like to join us and punish those who would do the world harm?
Tell me about the Green Hoods.
Tell me about the criminals.

The Green Hoods are a militia group founded by the legendary archer, Haster. The current commander is a firebrand named Oska. She's the fifth leader in the group's history, and some might say its greatest. If you want to meet her, you'll need to go to $map:02000076$.
Haven't you noticed? Petty crimes like theft and pickpocketing have skyrocketed since the earthquake. The guards are so busy trying to restore order that they can't keep eyes on everyone.

This couldn't be avoided. There's been such an enormous influx of people into the city from all over Maple World, there was bound to be more than a few bad apples. I just hope order will be restored soon.
Remember, you're not some aimless adventurer anymore. You're in the Green Hoods now, and that means you've got a mission and a creed. So, anything you'd like to ask?
What should I do now?

You're of no use to the Green Hoods without suitable gear. $npcName:11000004[gender:0]$ is a vendor of fine equipment, and probably has some great Archer gear for sale. After you're properly equipped, you should head beyond the city walls and dole out law to the lawless.

As you train, you'll ascend to new levels, and become ready to learn new skills. To see the skills you can learn, press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>.

Want to <font color="#ffd200">upgrade a skill</font>? Press <font color="#ffd200">K</font> to open the <font color="#ffd200">Skill window</font>, then press the plus sign next to the skill you'd like to improve.
Upgrading skills requires various types of crystals. One type, $itemPlural:40100001$, are available for purchase from supply merchant $npcName:11000010[gender:1]$ here in $map:02000001$.
<font color="#ffd200">Upgrading skills</font> requires Crystals.

$itemPlural:40100001$ are what remains after polishing rough crystals, and they're distributed throughout Maple World by $map:02000051$. You can easily find them by talking to supply merchants in big cities.

Of course, some materials are rarer than others, in particular the Red, Blue, and Green Crystals. They possess so much power that they are unstable, and only <font color="#ffd200">Elite</font> or <font color="#ffd200">Boss</font> enemies will drop them, and very infrequently. So you know, keep that in mind.
As for $itemPlural:40100022$… Well, you won't just find them lying around.
It's too bad you've decided not to join the Green Hoods. Still, we'd greatly appreciate any assistance you're willing to offer punishing those who bear ill will for the people of these lands.
Tell me about the Green Hoods.
Tell me about the criminals.
